intro: Carex scoparia var. muskingumensis, commonly known as Muskingum sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swales, and along the edges of ponds. The plant has cylindrical, grass-like leaves that are usually dark green and slightly hairy. Its flowering spikes are usually short and clustered, producing small, inconspicuous flowers. It plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
